page.title: 16DAIRY FARMING,PEMBROKE.
page.content: Many farmers to the south of{Pembroke} are dairy farmers. If a farmer keeps a herd of dairy cows to produce milk,the cows get nearly all the food they need during the summer by grazing the grass pastures. Some of the grass is made into hay or silage to provide the cows with food during the winter,when it is too cold for the grass to grow.The cows are then kept indoors in a large yard with a covered roof.Straw is used for bedding and the straw and dung are then used to manure the fields that are to grow root crops.The waste products of the farm are used in this way to help the crops to grow.
